questions.questionText: The motion of an object is represented by the speed–time graph shown. area under the graph speed (^0 0) time Which quantity is equal to the area under the graph?
Which statement about acceleration is correct?

options.A: It is related to the changing speed of an object.
options.B: It is the distance an object travels in one second.
options.C: It is the force acting on an object divided by the distance it travels in one second.
options.D:
It is the force acting on an object when it is near to the Earth.

questions.questionText: Two metal blocks P and Q have identical dimensions. They hang on identical spring balances. #### 0 1 2 3 4 6 #### 5 N (^0) 1 2 3 4 6 #### 5 #### N #### Q #### P Which statement about P and Q is correct?

options.A: They have different volumes and different weights.
options.B: They have different volumes and equal weights.
options.C: They have equal volumes and equal weights.
options.D: They have equal volumes and different weights.

Four solid objects are lowered in turn into the liquid. The densities of the objects are shown. 1 0.40 g / cm^3 2 0.90 g / cm^3 3 1.2 g / cm^3 4 2.7 g / cm^3 Which objects will float in the liquid?

X #### Y car What happens to the kinetic energy and to the gravitational potential energy of the car as itmoves from position X to position Y? kinetic energy (^) potential energygravitational

Student P uses a force of 35 N to push a box 3.0 m across the floor. Student Q uses a force of 22 N to push another box 1.8 m across the floor. Which statement gives a full explanation why student P uses more energy than student Q?

options.A: Student P pushes his box a greater distance than student Q.
options.B: Student P pushes his box a greater distance and uses a bigger force than student Q.
options.C: Student P uses a bigger force than student Q.
options.D:
Student P pushes a heavier box than student Q.

options.A:
man can either take an escalator or a lift to travel up between two floors in a hotel. 

 escalator lift The escalator takes 20 seconds to carry the man between the two floors. The useful work done against gravity is W. The useful power developed is P. The lift takes 30 seconds to carry the same man between the same two floors. How much useful work against gravity is done by the lift, and how much useful power isdeveloped by the lift? 

 useful work done against gravity by lift developed by liftuseful power

questions.questionText: When a hot gas is left to cool, its internal energy decreases. What causes this?

options.A: a decrease in the kinetic energy of the gas particles
options.B: a decrease in the gravitational potential energy of the gas particles
options.C: an increase in the average speed of the gas particles
options.D: an increase in the average distance of separation of the gas particles

questions.questionText: What is the nucleon number of a nuclide?

options.A: the number of neutrons in the nucleus
options.B: the number of protons in the nucleus
options.C: the number of protons minus the number of neutrons in the nucleus
options.D:
the number of protons plus the number of neutrons in the nucleus
